trans-unit.source: Represents the `<cookieHandler>` configuration element.

The `<cookieHandler>` element is a child element of the `<federatedAuthentication>` element; the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.FederatedAuthenticationElement.CookieHandler%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is set to an instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement> class.

The `<cookieHandler>` element is used to configure the cookie handler used by the Session Authentication Module (SAM), which is represented by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SessionAuthenticationModule> class.
A cookie handler can be configured in one of the following ways:

To configure a chunked cookie handler, set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.Mode%2A> property to either <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerMode.Default> or <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerMode.Chunked> and set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.ChunkedCookieHandler%2A> property with the configuration element for your chunked cookie handler.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.CustomCookieHandler%2A> property should not be set.

To configure a chunked cookie handler with the default chunk size, you can set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.Mode%2A> property as mentioned earlier, but leave both the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.ChunkedCookieHandler%2A> and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.CustomCookieHandler%2A> properties unset.

To configure a custom cookie handler, set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.Mode%2A> property to <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerMode.Custom> and set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.CustomCookieHandler%2A> property with the configuration element that identifies the type of your custom cookie handler.
This type must derive from the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandler> class.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.ChunkedCookieHandler%2A> property should not be set.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement"></xref> class.
Gets or sets a chunked cookie handler.
This property is equivalent to the `<chunkedCookieHandler>` child element of the `<cookieHandler>` element.
It specifies a chunked cookie handler, an instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.ChunkedCookieHandler> class, to use.

If it is set, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.Mode%2A> property should be set to either <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerMode.Default> or <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerMode.Chunked>.

If the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.Mode%2A> property is set to either of these values but the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.ChunkedCookieHandler%2A> property is not set, a chunked cookie handler with the default chunk size (<xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.ChunkedCookieHandler.DefaultChunkSize?displayProperty=fullName>) is configured.

Either the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.ChunkedCookieHandler%2A> property or the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.CustomCookieHandler%2A> property may be set, but not both.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.ChunkedCookieHandlerElement"></xref> that provides additional configuration for the chunked cookie handler.
Gets or sets a custom cookie handler type.
This property must be set when a custom cookie handler is being configured.
This property is equivalent to the `<customCookieHandler>` child element of the `<cookieHandler>` element.
It specifies a custom cookie handler type to use.
If this property is set, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.Mode%2A> property must be set to <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerMode.Custom>.
The custom type specified by this property must be derived from the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandler> class.

Either the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.ChunkedCookieHandler%2A> property or the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.CustomCookieHandler%2A> property may be set, but not both.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Configuration.CustomTypeElement"></xref> that defines the custom cookie handler type.
Gets or sets the domain value for cookies written by the handler.
Represents the `domain` attribute of the [\<cookieHandler\>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/windows-identity-foundation/cookiehandler.md) element.
The domain value.
The default is an empty string.
Gets a new cookie handler based on the configuration properties.
This method returns a cookie handler that is consistent with the configuration.
The cookie handler returned will be either a chunked cookie handler or a custom cookie handler depending on how the configuration properties are set.
For more information, see <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement>.
The cookie handler.

This will be an instance of <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandler"></xref> or <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.ChunkedCookieHandler"></xref> depending on the kind of handler that is configured by the properties of the current instance.
A cookie handler cannot be created from the properties of the current instance.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the `httpOnly` property of the cookies written by this handler should be set.
Controls whether the "HttpOnly" flag is emitted for any cookies written.
Certain Web browsers honor this flag by keeping client-side script from accessing the cookie value.
Represents the `hideFromScript` attribute of the [\<cookieHandler\>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/windows-identity-foundation/cookiehandler.md) element.
`true` if the `httpOnly` property should be set; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Gets or sets the cookie handler mode.

For chunked cookie handlers (the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.ChunkedCookieHandler%2A> property is set), the mode should be set to either <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerMode.Chunked> or <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerMode.Default>.

For a custom cookie handler (the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.CustomCookieHandler%2A> property is set), the mode should be set to <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerMode.Custom>.
Represents the `mode` attribute of the [\<cookieHandler\>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/windows-identity-foundation/cookiehandler.md) element.
A valid <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerMode"></xref> value that indicates the kind of cookie handler that is being configured.
The default value is <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerMode.Default"></xref>, which indicates a chunked cookie handler.
Gets or sets the base name for any cookies written by the handler.
Represents the `name` attribute of the [\<cookieHandler\>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/windows-identity-foundation/cookiehandler.md) element.
The base name for the cookies.
The default is "FedAuth".
Gets or sets the path value for cookies written by the handler.
If no path is defined, the path defined by the <xref:System.Web.HttpRuntime.AppDomainAppVirtualPath%2A> property is used.
Represents the `path` attribute of the [\<cookieHandler\>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/windows-identity-foundation/cookiehandler.md) element.
A string that contains the path.
Gets or sets the lifetime of cookies issued by the handler.
Represents the `persistentSessionLifetime` attribute of the [\<cookieHandler\>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/windows-identity-foundation/cookiehandler.md) element.
A <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> that represents the cookie lifetime.
The default is 0 days ("0.0:0:0").
The value must be a value between 0 ("0.0:0:0") and 365 ("365.0:0:0") days.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the cookie should be used only with SSL.
Controls whether the "Secure" flag is emitted for any cookies written.
If this value is `true`, the sign-in session cookies will only be available over HTTPS.
Represents the `requireSSL` attribute of the [\<cookieHandler\>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/windows-identity-foundation/cookiehandler.md) element.
`true` if the cookie should only be used over an SSL connection; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
